think_procedure: 1. Identify the purpose of the 'lock_timeout' knob in PostgreSQL. 2. Understand that it controls the maximum time to wait for a lock before timing out. 3. Determine if there are any special values that alter its behavior significantly. 4. Note that setting 'lock_timeout' to 0 means no waiting, which is a special behavior. 5. Conclude that 'lock_timeout' has a special value (0) that changes its function.
